p: Patients were 49.3% males with a mean age of 60 years (SD ±13.5), and 31.9% of them were cirrhotic. Patients in treatment with antipsychotic drugs were younger (50.6 vs. 64.9 years, p < 0.001), mostly males (67.4% vs. 41.6%, p = 0.006), the main route of transmission was intravenous drug use (46.5% vs. 16.9%, p < 0.001) and were more frequently infected with HCV genotype 1a (34.9% vs. 16.8%, p = 0.020), and genotype 3 (30.2% vs. 4.9%, p < 0.001).
